title: Arctic Wolf Aurora Endpoint Security Application and Device Control Insights
description: This dashboard provides a comprehensive summary of aurora protect application and device control events.

definition.content:
[Arctic Wolf Aurora Endpoint Security](https://docs.arcticwolf.com/bundle/AES-Overview/page/What-is-Aurora-Endpoint-Security.html) is a unified solution that helpsÂ  to tackle modern threats. It provides comprehensive capabilities to detect and protect against threats across endpoints.

This dashboard provides a comprehensive summary of aurora protect application and device control events.

For more information, see the [Arctic Wolf Aurora Endpoint Security Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/arctic_wolf_aurora_platform/).

**Tips**
- Use the timeframe selector in the upper-right corner of the dashboard to change the default timeframe.
- Clone this dashboard to rearrange, modify, and add widgets and visualizations.

Displays application control activity such as allowed or denied actions, file execution attempts, external drive executions, and PE file changes. It highlights key details including event type, file path, device information, file hash (SHA256), and the zones the device belongs to, helping you quickly understand how files and applications are behaving and whether any execution attempts require attention.

Shows key administrative activity such as logins, policy changes, device actions, rule updates, configuration changes and many more. Helps track who did what and when, making it easier to review changes and support audit needs.

Shows updates and changes related to devices, including registrations, policy assignments, device removals, name changes, zone updates, logged-in users, and agent versions. Helps track how each device is configured, who updated it, and what changes were made over time.

Shows activity related to external device usage, including when USB or other removable media are blocked, allowed, or set to read-only. Includes details about the connected device type, vendor, product ID, serial number, and the zones the endpoint belongs to, helping monitor and control how external devices interact with protected systems.
